website_summaries.verdict: The most affordable NETGEAR modem that works with all Xfinity plans.
pros: Supports cable internet plans up to 200 Mbps
Compatible with Xfinity from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox, Cablevision, and more
cons: Must get a separate router for WiFi
Doesn't support speeds as fast as more expensive models

customer_reviews.title: Average Guy, not a techie
customer_reviews.text: We have Comcast, this modem is supported by Comcast and it’s super easy to set up. It took less than ten minutes. If you have Comcast there are specific instructions to set it up. Very easy. The modem works so far. Our internet speeds are where they are supposed to be. Stop renting your modem and buy it! As for technical stuff I have no idea what any of it is without googling something. I paired it with a LINKSYS EA7300 wireless router and am now enjoying way better connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: YEMSG

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price for a cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 5 months. When I called Netgear for technical support, they wanted to charge me $140 to fix it over the phone or replace the item!!! Apparently the warranty is only 3 months, otherwise they'll charge you this ridiculous amount of money if you need help. The rep was very adamant about taking my credit card information and I finally had enough and just hung up. That must be where they make up for the cheap price. Cheap price for a cheap product.
customer_reviews.author: DooWop51219

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK RIGHT WITH XFINITY INTERNET
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to be able to use Xfinity internet at 60MB. specks said it should work. I got about 7mb down and .7mb up. Comcast came out to see what was up and debug as I was a new user. New cable ends new connectors etc. Nothing fixed the problem. As a last try, we hooked up a rental xfinity cable modem/wifi router and performance went to 70MB down and 7mb up. I hooked my old ABUS wifi router to their modem and still get the 70mb down. Unfortunately, I missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile if you lease your existing modem. That being said, returning it because I couldn't get it to work with Xfinity.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the CM500 to replace my Motorola cable modem with Xfinity. I went through the setup procedure, including the Comcast activation. For whatever reason, it simply would never activate through Xfinity, nor could the support people get it working despite considerable time on the phone. I finally gave up and plugged my Surfboard back in, which worked perfectly fine. I cannot be certain as to whether this was an issue with the modem or an issue with Xfinity. I'll add that the Surfboard is built like a tank, though similar in size. The Netgear unit is lightweight, bordering on flimsy. Both are only DOCSIS 3.0, despite the Surfboard being years older.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working
customer_reviews.text: This modem quit working in less than two months. If you call their service center during business hours (they're open 24/7) be prepared to wait a very long time. The first time I called I waited one hour, the second was forty five minutes. If your modem breaks and it's still under their one year warranty, you'll need to mail it in at your expense and be without internet. I went to Xfinity and waited in line an hour to get their modem. This is the second NETGEAR cable modem I've purchased and the first one lasted over two months, Amazon refunded my money that time.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D.

customer_reviews.title: Discarding this modem after less than 5 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I’m in the process of replacing and discarding this modem after less than five months of use. I purchased it new. It worked fine for the first two months. In the third month, it started dropping the connection (Spectrum 300 MB/s) about once a week. By the fourth month, the connection was dropping daily. Now, in the fifth month, it drops several times per day. I’ve been a TWC/Spectrum internet customer for over 15 years at this location and have never had connectivity issues like this. It’s definitely this Netgear modem. The modem log consists primarily of two types of failure events: “Sync Timing Synchronization failure” and “No Maintenance Broadcasts for Ranging opportunities received.“
customer_reviews.author: kgs

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Works
customer_reviews.text: We got the NetGear as part of the Amazon Black Friday Deal. The first unit that we got was defective, however thanks to the excellent support by Amazon, this got replaced. On receiving the updated equipment, followed the setup instructions on the pack. It took exactly 10 minutes to set this up. Please note that they recommend plugin an Ethernet for setup, and if you are on a mac (like I am), you will need an adaptor (I had one - you can get one here: After the setup, my WIFI speeds seems to be more stable and much much faster. Hitting 100 MBPS over air.
customer_reviews.author: Vivek Raman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a cheap modem for Xfinity internet 150mb/s plan. The product came neatly packaged, and the instructions provided made set up simple. For the first month I had no issues. However, I started having connectivity issues soon after where the signal would drop every couple of days and the modem would take up to admit it to reset itself. Eventually, this became a daily occurrence with multiple episodes throughout the day. The modem eventually died within 14 months. I eventually decided against another Netgear modem due to this issue. So if you want to waste your money definitely purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for months now as a replacement to my old modem. I'm glad I'm not paying Comcast anymore to rent their modem/router combo every month. Setup was a breeze and I paired this with a nice Nighthawk wireless router to give my whole home good speeds. We currently have a ~100mbit connection and this has been performing fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Simple Install Plug and Play but Tiniest Hard to Read Status Lights.
customer_reviews.text: The cable modem was easy to install. I wanted something without wireless or enet ports as I already have my own network. I use Cox Cable and it connected right away. Just simple connect to coax, ethernet port and power up. It goes through a boot up sequence then after many seconds connections to modem and your local router. However, the status lights are ridiculous to use. They are tiny and dim. There is about a 10 degree viewing window that you have to be within to even see them lit up. The ID lettering is not backlit and you cannot read them so dim or dark area bring a lamp if you want to read the status lights.
customer_reviews.author: rkruz

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work with Xfinity/Comcast
customer_reviews.text: This modem does NOT WORK WITH XFINITY/Comcast - it pauses every few minutes and is irritating as hell. If you have Xfinity or Comcast as a provider do NOT buy this modem! Even after you call in to Xfinity customer support to update the serial number of the modem you are using. Pauses way too often.
customer_reviews.author: PunkInParkZoo

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Give Up Your First Born To Register
customer_reviews.text: All I wanted was a modem. The modem installs easily and works fine. But to register it? You have to create an account and agree to all sorts of crap that you don't want to agree to. And there's no way to contact them by email. All they have is FAQs. I won't buy anymore NETGEAR products. All they need from me is my contact info - an email address, the serial number and date of purchase. That's it. For $60 I'm not agreeing to a bunch of other crap.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Timothy L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Stay away from Netgear
customer_reviews.text: Took about 2 1/2 hours to finally set up, as the instructions were nowhere easy, and when I finally got it working it would ONLY connect to one old 2013 laptop with an ethernet port. Wouldn't work with my Wifi Apple base station or a Wifi extender. Tried calling Netgear support and they said there was nothing they could do as the manufacturer date was October 2018. I bought this NEW on Amazon! After this experience, I'm never buying any Netgear product ever again. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R.L.

customer_reviews.title: A Good Modem
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem to replace an old outdated Motorola Surfboard modem that I've been using since 2012. The only issue was not with the modem, but with Spectrum. The self install website kept repeatedly crashing after a few screens, and wouldn't let me set it up. I finally called and after waiting for quite awhile and being hung up on once, they finally activated it. The modem is very stable and I'm getting even faster download speed than I had before. I think this is a good modem for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Bruski

customer_reviews.title: Why rent when you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: 30 APR 2020 This modem works with Comcast just make sure you have a wireless router. This modem was easy to set and took less than ten minute for me to set up. Everything that was needed for set up was included in the box. It is a much cheaper and viable option to purchase a modem rather than renting one from your internet provider. I have not had any issues with this modem and I have always been a fan of Netgear for their quick setups and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: -T

customer_reviews.title: This item may not work!
customer_reviews.text: This modem never worked properly. it would cut off when I was in the middle of an on-line game or message. It finally stopped (after 2 months) accepting the internet connection from my cable company. I installed a new Motorola today, and it worked fine, connected immediately and I'm happy. I am very unhappy that I cannot return this item, especially since I bought the service contract which is not refundable either. I do not want this item in my home and will not buy another Net Gear product. I will think twice before buying any more electronics from Amazon. The short period to return is ridiculous. Doreen Streltzoff
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Streltzoff

customer_reviews.title: Fast wifi and great price!
customer_reviews.text: The version I got was *new* but from Amazon warehouse. Other than the packaging (which came as shown in picture, as opposed to the typical Amazon cardboard box), everything inside was new. I was on the phone with my Internet provider before installing it, and they were on the phone with me to switch to the rental modem to this Netgear one. The modem itself is so easy to install - you basically just plug in the cable chord to connect it to the wall, and the power outlet. Note that unless you plan on using an Ethernet chord, you will need to get a router as well.
customer_reviews.author: thescarletterosedc

customer_reviews.title: Ultimately sucks.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had it round about 5-6 months. It was easy to set up, though I did have to call Mediacom to finish because the website given didnt work. It was good at first and served our purpose of allowing us to play red dead online without being constantly kicked. However, it is now not allowing our full speeds to trickle through. So I’ll probably have to revert back to our original problem as a sacrifice to getting our full speeds. Also, it’s not MoCA compatible. So beware if you’re a tivo user.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: The device seems dependable
customer_reviews.text: I had owned a modem/router that had begun to malfunction. A technician from my ISP looked at the unit and confided that his own home setup employed a Netgear cable modem, and that he personally avoided units that combined the router and modem functions because they tended to be more cheaply made and less durable. I took his advice and bought a Netgear modem and a separate router, and I am pleased with the performance and reliability. I'd much rather have bought the devices myself than have to pay a monthly rental fee for my ISP's equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Tax Mechanic (Ret.)

customer_reviews.title: WAS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH XFINITY
customer_reviews.text: We were on the phone 5 different times with XFINITY to register this product...every time was unsuccessful. We then had a technician come out 2 different times and once again we were unable to register this modem with XFINITY. Very disappointed having wasted so much time and effort with this modem and it will not work with our service. Be very careful if you have XFINITY and want to purchase this modem. The "icing on the cake" was when I tried to return it...it took so many phone calls and visits that I'm now out of the return window. So I wasted $63 and have an ugly paper weight on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy works for Mediacom
customer_reviews.text: Works great we have mediacom and there provided modem was horrible it never got the advertised speeds we payed for which was 1gb and on top of that we was stuck with them blocking access to all ports and being forced to use there web Interface configuration page which was complete crap. We didn't want to spend the 2pp bucks for a docsis 3.1 so we downgraded to the 500 mb plan and got this modem I must say I'm impressed with the speeds I'm getting I'm peaking just over 600Mb downloads and can open any ports I choose not to mention it saves me 10 bucks a month modem rental I recommend to anyone on mediacom.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin C

customer_reviews.title: Easy and sped up my network!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old netgear router, but when we all started working at home is just wasn't quite enough to give us all fast speeds. I have one of the newer netgear routers, so I knew it was time to upgrade this also. Overall it works great and sped up my internet by about 40 mgbs which was great as I was already paying for these faster speeds but was getting just under them. Also, got this used (cause what difference does it really make when its sitting on a shelf or behind a cabinet) and it shipped just as fast and was in near perfect condition. If anything the box was just a little beat up.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable Modem for Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Well it didnt work the first attempt due to comcast menus and poor xfinity setup menus and procedures. On the 3rd attempt it activated, and that just takes time to happen. Be patient and make multiple attempts far apart. This modem is faster than the Xfinity supplied gateway, for which you oay 3 times the price of pirchase over a year. Good product. I was able to swap them without calling Xfinity. As for the external router setup (required for more than 1 connection) that also took 3 attempts and a couple reboots.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Fired right up
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t want to rent a cable modem/router from the ISP for $16 per month for a year, so I bought this. LESS then a 2 month payback, not bad at all. Connected right up to the xFinity ISP service. Used a Cat 5 Ethernet cable to connect to the AC1300 router in the 1st floor study ( ISP home entry point is in the basement on the opposite side of the house). My plan is for 100 MBs and I’m getting 109 MBs over WiFi in the dinning room next to the study. Very happy and time will tell. This is a xFinity recommended device. :-D
customer_reviews.author: Willie

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I pay for 150mbps with Cox in AZ, bought this to replace my 3 year old CM400 which has only pushing about 80mbps lately. Plugged it in, gave my ISP the necessary details and had the thing up and running in about 15 minutes. Ran a few wired speed tests and got around 165mbps, hooked up my new TP-Link AX3000 (which I'd also recommend if you wanna dip your toes into Wifi 6/AX) and the attached screenshot is from my phone going over wireless, about the same result as wired. The thing does it's job, hooray!
customer_reviews.author: Rand Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, worked out of the box. Excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived, I unpacked it, plugged it in, and it worked. What more can you ask? You do have to call your provider and go through a process of getting it registered, so don't plug your Wi-Fi router into it before that. And make sure that your provider's tech-support is available when you do this. That is, call during business hours. But the process was pretty easy. Internet providers, like Comcast, are very used to dealing with people who only do this kind of thing once every five years and don't know what they're doing. They are very good with instructions. If you are a typical non-technical user, don't worry.
customer_reviews.author: LaWeezel

customer_reviews.title: The most unreliable modem I've had
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade to docsis 3.0 and bought this one because it was affordable and had decent reviews. I did see others issues but thought I'd try it for myself. My previous modem was a no-frills Motorola and I rarely had issues. This model has continuously cut off my connection, sometimes for extended periods of time. I need to do work at home and it's the most frustrating thing ever. I just missed my return window and I'm so mad that I wasted money on this product. Not buying Netgear again.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Wtf?
customer_reviews.text: Searched wifi modem router combo and this popped up, I got to excited I guess and purchased, didnt realize until I had it hooked up it wasnt wifi. I know I should have read the description carefully, which I learned a frustrating lesson, but my ongoing frustration is why does this piece of equipment show up when I specifically searched WIFI? Waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Casey

customer_reviews.title: Working with Xfinity 175Mb plan
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to work with the Xfinity 175Mb plan. When I called Xfinity to activate the modem, Xfinity has two different model name for the CM500 in their system, one is CM500-100NAS, one is CM500v. If you tell them it's just CM500 (which is what it says at the bottom of this model) they would get confused. I ended up telling them it's CM500-100NAS and they were able to provision the modem and successfully tested resetting remotely from their end. CM500v is the model with voice port for your reference.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Soooooooooo....... where’s my internet signal???
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely horrible. It has no reach. Gotta be right up on it dang near to get connected. I have it running with an even more horrible Tenda router. I even bought a WiFi booster and still no reach. And it’s tiny as heck. Over half the size lesser than my rental modem. I think I wanna keep paying the fees and return this.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Lyrica

customer_reviews.title: Easy and stable
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't have been easier to install. Connected to a new 100Mb Comcast circuit and that was it. Been running solid for four months without a hiccup. Saves me a huge monthly modem rental, and lets me run the firewall of my choice without having the ISP sitting in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: Stopped being reliable after 8 months, tech support is expensive
customer_reviews.text: This modem worked great for 8 months then after a move it started dropping the wifi randomly several times a day and reconnecting on its own. Comcast confirmed it is a modem problem. NETGEAR Support wants $140 for a year of support or $50 for a single instance (7 days) of support. Cheaper just to buy a new modem with better support options and better reliability. I don't recommend this modem or Netgear in general after this episode.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: My son installed it for me
customer_reviews.text: Our old modem was too slow. This was a really great price. Costco was more than double the cost. Fry's Electronics is a hassle to get around. It was delivered the same day. My son says it is better for computer gaming. I can now watch Last Week Tonight with John Oliver. Life is good. I am really not the tech guy in the house. I were told by our cable provider what to buy. I got it ordered and delivered same day--within hours. It was not hard to install (watched son do it, read a book and sipped tea).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: The description says "all cable providers". Don't believe it. It refused to interface with WOW, and I went back to my very good 5 yr old Motorola. This thing simply wouldn't connect.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Works with xfinity
customer_reviews.text: Used this for an xfinity account. I did not follow the instructions. All I did was u plug the router. Connected the modem and let it sit 10 minutes. Once all lights turned green. I hooked it to the router and powered that on. Let it sit for a couple of minutes and go on my laptop. Opened a browser and it all connected automatically. Sent me to a xfinity activation page and I just followed the instructions. All in all, super easy to install. I didn’t have to talk to anyone. Did it all automatically. As far as the speed, it’s amazing, and runs like a beast.
customer_reviews.author: juan ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Garage
customer_reviews.text: This may be my first negative review on Amazon. I bought this router because my internet provider said I needed to upgrade. I experience random blackouts of service with this unit that were never a problem with my old device. Some interruptions to service last about a minute, others last close to 5. There is no rhythm or reason to when and why. There is also no noticeable or measurable speed or performance increase over the 5 year old cable modem I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Katbird

customer_reviews.title: it gets extremely hot after 1 years
customer_reviews.text: It is a good modem but it gets really hot after a while on. I have to turn it on and off to reset it. In the beginning, it was just a unplug and plug and it will come back to life immediately. However, after two years now, it will get super hot and even if I unplug and plug in, it will not work. I am looking for an replacement now. I am not sure how long the item should last but two year seems a bit short. Also, warranty expired in a year.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelearn

customer_reviews.title: The case is hard, shiny black plastic (not built to last)
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Motorola Arris Surfboard modem that has served me well. Its case is soft white plastic in a matte finish that does not break or become scratched when knocked over. The Netgear modem that is the subject of this review is made of hard, shiny black plastic that is easily scratched and could easily chip or crack if the modem falls over. Also, it is very easy to knock over possibly because its base is too small to stabilize it. I cannot comment on its functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Clouds Wind Mist

customer_reviews.title: This modem only last three months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem at Feb and at the end of May, Comcast told me my modem cannot receive signal anymore, I cannot return this modem back to the seller, I can only contact manufacture. This is a very disappointed experience, I wish I did not purchase this modem before, waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Not VPN compatible
customer_reviews.text: This router was great. High quality, easy setup and strong signal. I bought this router specifically because it was recommended by multiple VPN services that said it was compatible. The model I had was correct and said it was made in Vietnam. It was not compatible at all. I even hired a professional company to flash the VPN onto it and they couldn't do it. If you are looking for a VPN compatible router get the Linksys instead. It did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Had to order a 2nd unit
customer_reviews.text: The first modem arrived not working, spent considerable time on the phone with cable provider who could not get it to sync with the network. They advised I call netgear CS, after being on hold for extended period I decided to send it back and Amazon CS processed a return and covered overnight shipping for another one from netgear store. Second one work perfectly out of the box. 5 Stars for the device once working.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Must have got a dud..
customer_reviews.text: It worked for less than three hours. I bought this modem to replace a good working cable company-owned modem that was connected to a wireless router. This set-up had worked fine together for over two years. The new modem was setup properly with the cable company and was working great, but crashed for no obvious reason. It was hot when it quit. Tried everything to get it back online, spent over an hour trying without success. Got the old cable company-owned modem back up and was connected to internet, but soon realized that whatever happened fried the router too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy B. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Works great with optimum
customer_reviews.text: Got the modem installed and called optimum CS and after a couple of questions I was getting the speed that I was paying for but wasn't getting. If your paying for 200/35 and still have the old modem you won't be able to get that speed. Worse yet is that you're beign charge $10 a month for a modem that can't keep up with the speed that you're paying for.
customer_reviews.author: christian abreu

customer_reviews.title: Stay Connected!
customer_reviews.text: After having 2 Arris Surfboard SB6183 Modems never connect to our ISP Cox Cable properly, apparently the Intel Puma chip in those modems has been an issue for quite some time, we ordered the Netgear CM500(no Puma chip in this model). Thus far our installation and integration with our ASUS router has been seamless. I would recommend this modem for any Cox subscriber having issues. I will update if anything goes awry with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: S.Will

customer_reviews.title: Paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this modem to upgrade from our old modem that had been on the fritz lately. Our baby was born and I didn't get around to installing for 2 months. Modem is dead, doesn't work, Comcast cannot see the modem. Tried it at 2 locations with active cable lines and no connection. Receives upstream but no downstream. Factory reset, up to date firmware, nothing. Now I'm outside the return policy time frame. I'll have to seek support from netgear. Yippy
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a family member who was getting internet for the first time. Since the speed they were getting wasn't very high, I purchased this modem as why waste money? Set it up as instructed only to find product was defective. I found this by having a tech come out and putting a modem of his own which instantly worked. I've returned this item and then purchased a non-Netgear modem instead, which also instantly worked. My recommendation is to not buy this cheap thing.
customer_reviews.author: Epac El Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Works but...
customer_reviews.text: I got this because Cox said it would work. It does work but I have had to have a modem reset about every other week. I don't know if it's Cox, my wiring or this product. Once I do a reset it works again. I got a package deal from Cox that included a phone (that I didn't want but it was in the package) and it should be noted that this modem does not have a jack for the phone. Maybe I should have spent a little more for a more robust modem.
customer_reviews.author: GHD

customer_reviews.title: Netgear CM500 on Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I use Xfinity and not sure which modem will work. I am on 200 MB plan, but want to get a modem that will allow to expand if I were to change the speed. I checked several modems brand and model. Finally set my decision to Netgear CM500, it does not disappoint, it allows up to 600 mb download speed. I pair this CM500 with Orbi Wifi Mesh and I get the best of this combination. I constantly get around 230s download speed and 5-6 upload speed.
customer_reviews.author: Andi S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Works Well
customer_reviews.text: My service provider is Xfinity and I use this modem instead of paying for theirs. Small footprint. I wanted a straightforward, no frills wireless modem. I connected my AirPort Extreme and printer (HP 477 AirPrint multi function) to this unit with no issues. The signal is strong throughout my 1200 sq ft home.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, But Indicator Lights Almost Invisible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my ISP's cable modem and avoid monthly fees. For that it worked perfectly. I unplugged the old one, plugged in this new one, and followed the instructions. After everything powered up, I called my service provider and gave them the new modem's ID#. That was two weeks ago and the WIFi has been flawless. Minus one star because 1) the vertical design is not very steady, and 2) the indicator light are microscopic and not very bright. You can only really see the colors if you are looking directly at the side of the case in a dark room.
customer_reviews.author: E.E.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Netgear
customer_reviews.text: Had this modem since June 26th. Had to call cable company out to help install it. Never had to have onsite support before to assist me. Having to have onsite support again tomorrow. I bought with confidence from past Netgear products but have lost confidence now. Cable signal into house has been tested many times since installing this modem. If tomorrow pans out in a negative way, I'm going to ask for a refund/return of the CM500. It's ridiculous how my internet has worked so poorly since installing the CM500. In my opinion, avoid at all costs. Not worth the time, trouble or your dollars. Avoid..avoid..avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Ric Culross

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant to switch out my cable modem/router from Xfinity Comcast in fear of not being compatible. Decided to go with this cable modem after reading reviews and looking at Xfinity’s website. I must say it worked like a charm! Very easy to install using the instructions that came in the box. Only have had it on for a day so I will update my review if something goes bad but for now a total thumbs up! UPDATE: Still love the modem but went to Xfinity to return their modem/router and found out this modem does not support Triple Play. This is modem is only good for Double Play because it does not have a phone input.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: Works great, feels kind of cheap, challenge ISP support
customer_reviews.text: Warning: your ISP provided support may be morons. Was told on my first call that i couldn't register this modem because it didn't have phone line support and that was required by modems on Optimum's network. After spending several minutes arguing, I hung up and called back later to get someone who added the modem in less than 2 minutes. Has worked fairly flawlessly over the past few months and I'm very happy to be saving the modem rental cost. The only very modest downside I've noticed is how light and plasticy this unit is. It feels cheap, but as long as it continues to work, I'll be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jebediah Springfield

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for additional fees for customer support
customer_reviews.text: Great modem. Install was simple and I could within a day the increase in speed. Highly recommend, however I did not like that NETGEAR tried to sell an additional fee for customer service support. Haven't I already spent enough!!! Come on customer support should be free and would help increase customer satisfaction
customer_reviews.author: Pop

customer_reviews.title: Crap customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product in November, stopped letting the Service provider update it by April. Net gear wants me to send in the broken one before they will send out a new one or I have to pay $30 for shipping. So easy to send my barely working modem out during a pandemic when everybody is working from home. Horrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: christopher p.

customer_reviews.title: Solid and works with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: I really wish reviews would address the specific modem being reviewed rather than lumping multiple models under one review. You can get a false sense of the product. This review is for the CM500. This is a solid modem. Paired it with Netgear’s Nighthawk router and it is terrific. Didn’t want Xfinity’s combo modem/router where they have controls over it and make you a hotspot by default. Logged into this modem and changed password so I have control. Download speeds are at the service plan level I pay for and solid performance. Buy this and recover your rental fees in 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Q public

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Xfinity.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work with Comcast xfinity. Thanks for wasting my time amazon. Do yourself a favor and check the xfinity website for compatibility. You need the cm500V. The v at the end makes the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Lim Family❤️

customer_reviews.title: wouldn't connect
customer_reviews.text: I just opened this product a few days ago and attempted to connect it to the computer. I never could get it to connect so my son in law, who is much more computer literate than I am, came today to try and also could not get it to connect. I'm sure we will be told that we should have contacted tech support, but connecting a modem shouldn't be that hard!!! In the end, I got another modem and connected it in a matter of minutes, so now I am stuck with a modem that I can't use and it is too late to return it. What a waste!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions that people in the reviews provided along with the ones that came with the modem. I got everything set up and it was even showing up on my Xfinity account. The WiFi name never became available for me to connect too. I was even on the phone with customer service at Xfinity for an hour and they could not figure out what was wrong either. I guess I’ll just keep renting equipment from them.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Good modem, good price
customer_reviews.text: Modem works better than the one provided (at a cost which kept increasing) by my cable company, and is much lower profile. Had a couple of hiccups with setup, but I'll admit it was user error.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this s***
customer_reviews.text: you'll be tricked by the price/reviews, but believe me, it'll stop working the day when you are ineligible for return. It worked fine for a month, then it won't give any signal in the middle of meetings, internet will stop I thought it's from the net provider, i called them, they came, checked all, then i was charged the technical fee because it's wrong with my device not their cables, so I finished loosing $120. Plus I have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Qarawi

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Comcast BUSINESS
customer_reviews.text: The modem's specifications are compatible with the Comcast Business service we have. HOWEVER the Netgar Cable Modem CM500 modem is not on Comcast Business' list of approved modems. Therefore, Comcast would not allow it to connect to their network. If you are buying a modem to connect to Comcast Business, Google "comcast business approved modems" to find Comcast's list of approved modems.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so called great modem after carefully going through the reviews . But this product disappointed me , the setup was tough and took a long time . The setup page was timing out when I try to set this up manually . Was not able to reach netgear support . It had difficulty in pairing with my netgear router.the device often heats up in continuous use. Disappointed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sai

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Optimum Online 200/35 speed tier (no phone jacks)
customer_reviews.text: Works great for Optimum Online 200/35 speed tier. Never a problem. Make sure it is kept vertical with sufficient space on the sides, otherwise it can get a bit too hot. For those unfamiliar with it - it DOES NOT have phone jacks, internet only.
customer_reviews.author: JohnDoe155

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but doesn't come with required coax cable
customer_reviews.text: This modem works great and easily supports my 100 mbps internet connection without any issues. My main complaint is that the modem does not come with the required coax cable to install it. It does come with an ethernet cable, but everything required for installation is not included.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Netgear CM500: Great Speed, easy to set up for Non-Techies!
customer_reviews.text: Way back in 2010, my ex purchased a Netgear CM500 and it is still going strong. So when I needed a modem, I purchased and registered my CM500 Netgear Modem because I know that it's not only a great brand (Yay Netgear!) but that also it is a very durable modem and can go up to 650mbps speed. It also is so very easy to set up for a non-techie like me. Love love this modem! If your cable provider provides internet speeds up to 650mbps, you won't regret buying this modem.
customer_reviews.author: C4tw0m4n

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work with Optimum (Cablevision); fairly easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work with Optimum (Cablevision); installed fairly easily according to the enclosed instructions with no need (yet) to contact Tech Support. Oh, and in general, don't bother with Amazon's link to "Talk to a specialist" to find out if it works with your cable provider. They're not "specialists," and they have no clue.
customer_reviews.author: GrafZeppelin127

customer_reviews.title: Works for Xfinity/Comcast Easy Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace my really old modem/router, and it fit in perfectly. It can run a little on the warmer/hot side but usually when it's in a well ventilated area and you aren't stressing the modem at all it will run lukewarm. It works for Xfinity/Comcast and I've used it to run both my Unify AP and as a regular LAN Connection.
customer_reviews.author: Iyiahn

customer_reviews.title: Great cable modem. Easy to install and very stable.
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of problems with my previous cable modem, which was also a wi-fi router. Purchased Orbi's for wi-fi which worked great, but experienced intermittent outages from the modem. (wired direct connection too). So I replaced it with the Netgear CM500, and everything was worked perfectly since. The Orbi handles the wi-fi, and the modem passes traffic without stalling. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, save ur money
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk worked for 2 months then started having problems. I thought Comcast was the reason for the disruptions, contacted them and said it was all good except the modem was having problems communicating with them. I swapped this piece of plastic for my old modem and haven't had the problem since the swap. Seriously skip this modem and buy another. I missed the dead line to return this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Aruiz105

customer_reviews.title: EASIEST set up
customer_reviews.text: This modem received great reviews on independent sites. I chose it for that reason. I was a bit nervous about the set up. But it was a Breeze. Hook it up to the cable source and the wireless router and power source. Call your wireless provider and give them the number. Less than ten minutes and My Internet was up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Modem works fine
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE June 2018: Found out the problem I have isn’t a hardware problem at all, and is a problem with my cable internet service provider who had recently been bought out by Spectrum. The modem itself is working fine. I’ve updated my review to reflect that. Original review: It was perfect for the first two weeks, but since then, modem keeps resetting once or twice a day, usually at very bad times. Its pretty irritating. Not sure if its the modem, but I never had this problem until i switched to this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Rezanate

customer_reviews.title: Very good seller...fast shipping...recommend to others...A+...Mahalo....
customer_reviews.text: Item was easy to set-up but I made a mistake by ordering a wrong modem. I was looking for a wireless modem but, instead I purchased a wired modem. But both works very good. Do you have a wireless modem that goes with the router? I'm keeping this modem so not to worry. Please let me know it you have a compatible wireless modem to go with the wireless router. Hope to hear from you. Mahalo, Roy Yamamoto
customer_reviews.author: 94shadow

customer_reviews.title: Not working well on Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: TL; DR; With a new Xfinity subscription, start with a rental modem and buy your own only when you're sure the line is good. ****Update 10/21/2018**** Another Xfinity technician visited my house after failing to connect the rental modem did found an issue with their signal and told me this modem is actually supported. Here is my conclusion: When you start your Xfinity service, take their rental modem for 1-2 months, until you're sure the line is fine. Then switch to your own to cut down the cost *** Original Review *** After suffering connectivity issue for over a month, Xfininity technician told me, this model is explicitly excluded from their list
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have had the most success with Netgear modems in terms of consistent speed and reliability. Arris and Motorola both have crapped out on me. In terms of Modems this is the brand I will stick with. We pay for 200Mbps and this consistently gives me 230Mbps+. Also this has the older, more reliable chipset. Solid A+ unit
customer_reviews.author: mashedpotatoes

customer_reviews.title: Do it and start saving today!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot believe I paid XFINITY all these years. Don’t hesitate, buy it. We have two teens who stream for a living, Snapchat, we IG, FB, even have bonus children who FortNite and XBox, 2 Rokus and I work from home right now daily while pregnant. Oh—and we have a Ring doorbell and ADT system. Our connection (with WiFi router, of course) seems smoother than with Comcast’s modem. I hesitated on many occasions wondering if I’d have a positive experience or not. All is well. Make the switch and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Danitra L. Goss

customer_reviews.title: Great modem. Why pay provider for one?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a warehouse deal for $15! You can't beat that for a cable modem. It works great and it was the price of renting one for one month from Comcast. I am kicking myself for not doing this sooner. No one should be renting from the provider. They overcharge and take advantage of their customers.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: My modem lasted 4 months before I had problems with speed. Comcast identified the problem with the Netgear Modem. I called Netgear- their diagnostic had me completely lose connection to the internet. They said they would help me only 1 time then I needed to buy the warranty for $139 per year. Comcast equipment rental is cheaper. The customer service rep was outsourced to another country and was hard to understand and unhelpful. It's a bad day when Comcast is the most helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem for a client who was having at least a dozen service dropouts a day. They were on their third Comcast Business modem, and Comcast kept blaming them for the issues. I knew better, since their setup was very simple, with only three people and a couple printers connected at any one time. I installed this modem, called Comcast to activate it with their service, and they have been dropout free ever since. I paired it with a separate WiFi router and I couldn't be happier with how things are working now.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Only lasted just shy of 5 months. The “one year warranty” is only valid if you pay $90 for technical support, which is nonsense. Definitely don’t waste your time or money on this device.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackleford

customer_reviews.title: This unit does not provide a WiFi signal, only one port to a device that could access internet
customer_reviews.text: I'd pass on this router, I really can't imagine who would want a router that does not produce a WiFi signal. Again it only provides one hardwire port for a laptop to access the internet. Sadly, I has to goto Best Buy and buy the correct router that generates the WiFi signal ~ naturally it was 2x the cost but had to get it done while xfinity installer verified the access of Wifi. Was a big surprise and a let down.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Canning

customer_reviews.title: So simple, the Comcast guy couldn't believe it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this modem ahead of dumping the V guys. I got the C guy in and he had me going in less of 20 minutes! He figured an hour. Do your homework and find out it's cheaper to buy than rent. I'm not plugging one vendor here but $40.00 a month unlimited internet is fine with me. I own it. I got it here because Amazon gave the key words: Compatible with. Even if it dies, I can go back and order another with no home visit to change "numbers". Excellent unit. *
customer_reviews.author: Steve Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, does a reasonably good job, and relatively user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: NA wifi signal, NA tech support. I've been moving away from some of Netgear's products, but they have been rather reliable and easy to use. We still use this as our modem, not as a router. It would be nice if Netgear made their products more useful for tech experts and easier to poke at on deeper levels. Otherwise, this is pretty plug and play with some useful features and options.
customer_reviews.author: Remrie Arrie

customer_reviews.title: Set up easily on-line.
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an eight or nine year old modem with this one as we were having trouble with the internet cutting out frequently. This took care of the problem and our download speed is greatly improved too.
customer_reviews.author: Don Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Thank you COMCAST
customer_reviews.text: Comcast raised modem rental prices to about twice the purchase cost of this unit. Or - This unit paid for itself in half a year. No public WiFi but that was fine with me as I connected a switch to this cable modem and a wireless access point (WAP) to the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Jaffe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cable modem!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works Great!!! Took cable guy only couple munites to configure, works well with my TP-Link Archer 7 router. Installed and works great with Xfinity Comcast, using it on speed up to 60Mbps plan, but receiving up to 75Mbps. It is saving me $11 a month of Comcast bill, will pay itself off in less than 5 months. PS. This is an only cable modem, you'll need a router for it to work. Definitely, recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dimka S

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but only after hard reset
customer_reviews.text: This is third modem I tried since Cox continued saying I have modem problems, despite using new modems. It took 2 days of troubleshooting and only worked once I used the hard reset button on the back. There was one connection problem with Cox a few weeks ago that required another hard reset with the button but otherwise its been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kai

customer_reviews.title: Good value and reliable connection
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to setup. I just called my internet provider and it was up and running in a few minutes. It's also faster compared to my 3 years old modem/router combo. I decided to pick this instead of the combo because I already have a velop and it's working great now. My connection is more reliable all over my 2 story house. The only issue I got is the ethernet port that is only 1. I ended up buying a splitter that worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Marky

customer_reviews.title: Get the Arris Surfboard modem instead
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an old Arris modem that was capping at 90mbps even though I was paying for 150mbps. Unfortunately this modem had connection issues from day one. Was seeing tons of disconnects and dropped packets. Returned this and got the similarly priced/spec Arris and the problems went away. I rarely write reviews but this modem is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: I'm bummed. I work as an IT tech by day. Installation was easy. Started dropping Comcast connectivity quickly. Every couple of hours for about 10-20 minutes. Multiple calls to tech support at Comcast. Replaced the coax cables and splitter. Also returned the modem and for another. Same model. Same issue. The logs show critical issues all throughout the day. Went back to the rented modem from Comcast and now no dropouts. I'm cool with a bad modem but not two. They are either both bad or not compatible with Comcast Houston. Test months of frustration and an unhappy wife. It wasn't worth it. Staying with the rental but not happy about it
customer_reviews.author: D. Hassay

customer_reviews.title: It is a modem only. You will still need a router for
customer_reviews.text: It is a modem only. The one I removed was from Comcast. It worked fine but I was renting it $14, a month. I bought this but unknowingly I had to go to Best Buys and buy a router. Buy the combination. It much cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Ken in The Villages

customer_reviews.title: Good when not DOA...
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon product I ordered was DOA and wouldn't sync so I slapped the return slip on it and returned it yesterday. Straight after I decided to do a test and drive up to Best Buy and pay a few bucks more but it worked. So... I gained speed in download and upload just by getting this modem compared to the old Arris/Motorola SB6121 that always had issue with getting upgrades from Comcast/Xfinity. So far, so good with this new CM500 and I'm hoping it holds up. I'd have given 5 stars for this had the first one not been DOA but I gave it 4 for the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Benkosky

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Spectrum
customer_reviews.text: This modem (CM500-1AZNAS) is advertised as being compatible with Spectrum, but when I tried to install and activate, Spectrum said it was not compatible. I was past my return window unfortunately. I ended up having to get a variation of the same one that is compatible (CM500-100NAS) instead.
customer_reviews.author: B. C. Nance

customer_reviews.title: Pay a little more, you'll thank me later.
customer_reviews.text: After having for a while, this modem has proven to be very unreliable. Hard resets are a must daily just to maintain your internet speed, otherwise you'll be lucky to download at 1 or 2mbps. When accessing router which 80% of the time does NOT work, there are absolutely no settings you can change to optimize your router. In all, I would stay away from this modem and spend a little more for a higher quality more reliable router.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bailey

customer_reviews.title: It's junk. Overheated to no return in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: It's just. After 3 months it suddenly had a thermal runaway, overheated itself and never recovered. As others mentioned started dropping packets here and there, then finally totally bricked.
customer_reviews.author: champ

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had done this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, I got sick of paying for a cable modem. I finally purchased this one and I couldn't be happier. I set it up myself and it worked immediately. If you're thinking about cutting cable costs by purchasing this modem, I would advise you to do it! I could've saved myself a lot of money by cutting the cord a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with xfinity according to xfinity
customer_reviews.text: This was not compatible with xfinity according to my xfinity employee setting my system up. The sales person at xfinity gave me this as one to buy but it didn’t work. This may be more an issue with xfinity than with this product as xfinity’s explanations didn’t make sense. And more expensive one bought at wal mart with advertised compatability with xfinity also didn’t work. Now I am stuck leasing one with xfinity and now left with this purchase that is useless. I would not buy this or any other one for use with xfinity without absolutely getting written recommendations and guarantees from xfinity.
customer_reviews.author: ANM

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: All directions followed as instructed, still could not mak a connection with ether modem (this was the second one we tried). Neither would pick up a signal, even the installation tech couldn't get it ti pick up.... total waste of time and money.Don
customer_reviews.author: Grannema

customer_reviews.title: NOT Xfinity compatible
customer_reviews.text: The description said it worked with Xfinity. When the technician came to my house and ran a test he said this was an outdated model and I needed to get a different modem. In order to get my internet up I had to rent their modem. Very frustrating!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Deal

customer_reviews.title: Warranty claim
customer_reviews.text: This product was working fine initially but it failed after 6- 7 months. I wanted to request a replacement under warranty but the tech rep requested me to register tech service around $100. I decided not to initiate a claim with $100 for this modem, around $60.
customer_reviews.author: cheolminlee

product_meta.title: NETGEAR Cable Modem CM500 - Compatible With All Cable Providers Including Xfinity by Comcast, Spectrum, Cox | For Cable Plans Up to 300 Mbps | DOCSIS 3.0
product_meta.description:
Style:300Mbps Max Download| Pattern Name:Single

The NETGEAR CM500 high speed Cable Modem provides a connection to high-speed cable Internet, up to 680Mbps. It is cable labs Certified and with DOCSIS 3. 0 is 16x faster than 2. 0 devices. It works with U. S. Cable Internet provider Comcast XFINITY & more. It is not compatible with cable bundled Voice services.

System Requirements

 * Cable Broadband Internet service
 * Please check your cable Internet service provider web site for data speed tier compatibility
 * Microsoft Windows 7, 8, 10, Vista, XP, 2000, Mac OS, or other operating systems running a TCP/IP network
 * Microsoft Internet Explorer 5.0, Firefox 2.0, Safari 1.4, or Google Chrome 11.0 browsers or higher.
feature_bullets: Compatible with all major cable internet providers: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast, COX, and Spectrum. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service.
Save monthly rental fees: Model CM500 replaces your cable modem saving you up to $168/yr in equipment rental fees.
Built for fast speed: best for cable provider plans up to 300 mbps speed.
Works with any wifi router: Connect any WiFi router to this modem's Ethernet port to support all your wireless devices.
Ethernet connections: 1 Gigabit Ethernet port connects to your computer or separate WiFi router.
Modem technology: Engineered with 16x4 channel bonding and DOCSIS 3.0.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars16,540 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
